damage_description: Severe storm and flooding caused significant damage to roads and bridges in Chittenden, Grand Isle, Lamoille, Orange, and Orleans Counties.
resource_description: State and local resources have been committed to respond to the severe storm and flooding event. Further details are included in the Governor's cover letter.
pa_categories_requested: Emergency Work and the repair or replacement of facilities damaged by the severe storm and flooding
pa_programs_needed_per_area: Chittenden County, Grand Isle County, Lamoille County, Orange County, Orleans County
debris_removal_needed: I anticipate the need for debris removal, which poses an immediate threat to lives, public health and safety.

request_purpose: Individual Assistance, Public Assistance, and Hazard Mitigation
damage_description: Earthquake caused significant damage to residences and public infrastructure in Alaska, specifically impacting the Municipality of Anchorage, Kenai Peninsula Borough, and Matanuska-Susitna Borough. A total of 2,848 residences were impacted: 46 destroyed, 638 with major damage, 1,110 with minor damage, and 1,054 affected. Public infrastructure, including buildings and equipment, also sustained considerable damage.
resource_description: State and local governments have committed resources to assess the damage and provide initial response. Additional details regarding the specific nature and amount of resources committed will be provided in the Governor's cover letter.
ia_requested_programs: Not specified in report - Assumed to be standard IA Programs such as Individuals and Households Program (IHP), Crisis Counseling, Disaster Unemployment Assistance, etc.
ia_programs_needed_per_area: Municipality of Anchorage, Kenai Peninsula Borough, and Matanuska-Susitna Borough.
pa_categories_requested: A-G (Emergency Work and the repair or replacement of facilities damaged by the earthquake)
pa_programs_needed_per_area: Municipality of Anchorage, Kenai Peninsula Borough, and Matanuska-Susitna Borough.
debris_removal_needed: I anticipate the need for debris removal, which poses an immediate threat to lives, public health and safety.

damage_description: Tropical Storm Michael caused significant damage to parks and recreation facilities in 21 counties across North Carolina. The total Public Assistance cost estimate is $23,487,820. The counties with the highest per capita impact include Brunswick, Caswell, Dare, Person, and Stokes.
resource_description: State and local resources have been committed to response and recovery efforts. Further details are provided in the Governor's cover letter.
pa_categories_requested: Emergency work and the repair or replacement of facilities damaged by Tropical Storm Michael
pa_programs_needed_per_area: Alamance, Brunswick, Caswell, Chatham, Dare, Davidson, Davie, Forsyth, Granville, Hyde, Iredell, McDowell, Montgomery, Orange, Person, Randolph, Rockingham, Stokes, Surry, Vance, and Yadkin Counties
debris_removal_needed: I anticipate the need for debris removal, which poses an immediate threat to lives, public health and safety.

damage_description: Severe storm and flooding caused significant damage to public infrastructure, particularly parks and recreation, in Rockingham County. The countywide per capita impact is estimated at $11.33.
resource_description: State and local resources have been committed to respond to the immediate needs, including emergency work to stabilize the impacted areas. Further details on resource commitment will be provided in the Governor's cover letter.
pa_categories_requested: Emergency Work, Repair or Replacement of Facilities
debris_removal_needed: I anticipate the need for debris removal, which poses an immediate threat to lives, public health and safety.

damage_description: Severe storms, tornadoes, straight-line winds, and flooding caused significant damage to roads and bridges in Cedar, Colfax, Cuming, Dakota, Dixon, Harlan, Logan, Thomas, Thurston, and Wayne Counties.
resource_description: State and local resources have been committed to respond to the disaster. Further details will be provided in the Governor's cover letter.

damage_description: Flooding caused damage to railroad owned and maintained by the Alaska Railroad Corporation in Matanuska-Susitna Borough. Total Public Assistance cost estimate: $2,011,378. Statewide per capita impact: $2.83. Countywide per capita impact: Matanuska-Susitna Borough ($22.60).
resource_description: Resources committed include state and local government resources. Specific details regarding the nature and amount of these resources are included in the Governor's cover letter.
pa_categories_requested: A & B (Emergency Work) and C-G (Repair or Replacement of Damaged Facilities)
debris_removal_needed: I anticipate the need for debris removal, which poses an immediate threat to lives, public health and safety.

request_purpose: Individual Assistance, Public Assistance, and Hazard Mitigation
damage_description: Severe storms, tornadoes, and straight-line winds caused significant damage to residences and public infrastructure in Connecticut. A total of 604 residences were impacted, with 25 destroyed, 146 with major damage, 269 with minor damage, and 164 affected. Primary Public Assistance impact is associated with debris removal. The total Public Assistance cost estimate is $13,247,081.
resource_description: State and local resources have been committed to address the immediate needs resulting from the severe storms, tornadoes, and straight-line winds. Specific details on the nature and amount of these resources will be provided in the Governor's cover letter.
ia_requested_programs: Not specified in the report, but typically includes Individuals and Households Program (IHP), Crisis Counseling, Disaster Unemployment Assistance, Disaster Legal Services, and Small Business Administration (SBA) loans.
ia_programs_needed_per_area: Fairfield County, New Haven County, and three municipalities (unspecified) require the full range of Individual Assistance programs to address housing needs, personal property losses, and other disaster-related expenses.
ia_affected_tribes: Not applicable, the report does not mention Federally-recognized Tribes.
pa_categories_requested: A, B (Debris Removal, Emergency Protective Measures)
pa_programs_needed_per_area: Fairfield County and New Haven County require Public Assistance Categories A and B to address debris removal from public property and implement emergency protective measures to ensure public safety.
pa_affected_tribes: Not applicable, the report does not mention Federally-recognized Tribes.
debris_removal_needed: I anticipate the need for debris removal, which poses an immediate threat to lives, public health and safety.

request_purpose: Public Assistance, including snow assistance for five counties and Hazard Mitigation for the entire commonwealth.
damage_description: Severe winter storm and snowstorm caused significant damages in Essex, Middlesex, Norfolk, Suffolk, and Worcester Counties. The primary impact was on emergency protective measures. Total Public Assistance cost estimate: $21,470,787. Countywide per capita impact: Essex County ($3.88), Middlesex County ($3.86), Norfolk County ($4.17), Suffolk County ($9.63), and Worcester County ($3.80).
resource_description: Details regarding the nature and amount of State and local resources committed are included in the enclosed Governor's cover letter.
pa_categories_requested: Emergency work and the repair or replacement of facilities damaged by the severe winter storm and snowstorm. Snow assistance for a period of 48 hours.
pa_programs_needed_per_area: Essex, Middlesex, Norfolk, Suffolk, and Worcester Counties.
debris_removal_needed: I anticipate the need for debris removal, which poses an immediate threat to lives, public health and safety.
snow_assistance_jurisdictions: Essex, Middlesex, Norfolk, Suffolk, and Worcester Counties

damage_description: Tropical Storm Gita caused significant damage to residences and utilities in American Samoa. 56 residences were destroyed, 180 sustained major damage, 632 sustained minor damage, and 82 were affected. The primary impact to the public sector was damage to utilities.
ia_requested_programs: Not specified in detail within the report but implied by the Governor's request and the subsequent declaration. Likely includes Housing Assistance, Other Needs Assistance, and Crisis Counseling.
ia_programs_needed_per_area: American Samoa (territory-wide). Housing Assistance, Other Needs Assistance, and Crisis Counseling are likely needed across the territory.
ia_affected_tribes: Not applicable, American Samoa is a territory.
pa_categories_requested: A, B, C, D, E, F, G (Emergency Work and the repair or replacement of facilities damaged by Tropical Storm Gita)
pa_programs_needed_per_area: American Samoa (territory-wide). Emergency work (Categories A & B) and repair/replacement of damaged facilities (Categories C-G) are needed across the territory.
pa_affected_tribes: Not applicable, American Samoa is a territory.
debris_removal_needed: I anticipate the need for debris removal, which poses an immediate threat to lives, public health and safety.

request_purpose: Individual Assistance, Public Assistance, Hazard Mitigation
damage_description: Severe storms, tornadoes, straight-line winds, and flooding impacted Oklahoma during the period of April 30 to May 1, 2019. The storms caused widespread damage to residences, roads, and bridges. A total of 199 residences were impacted, with 44 destroyed, 61 sustaining major damage, 51 with minor damage, and 43 affected.
resource_description: State and local resources have been committed to response and recovery efforts. Specific details are included in the Governor's cover letter.
ia_requested_programs: Not specified in report. Typically includes Individuals and Households Program (IHP), Crisis Counseling Program (CCP), Disaster Unemployment Assistance (DUA), Legal Services, and Disaster Case Management (DCM).
ia_affected_tribes: Not specified in the report. Further research is needed to identify Federally-recognized Tribes in the requested counties.
pa_categories_requested: Categories A-G (Emergency Work and Repair/Replacement of Damaged Facilities)
pa_programs_needed_per_area: Alfalfa, Atoka, Bryan, Coal, Craig, Kay, Lincoln, Love, Major, Noble, Nowata, Okmulgee, Osage, Ottawa, Pittsburg, Pushmataha, Stephens, and Tillman Counties.
pa_affected_tribes: Not specified in the report. Further research is needed to identify Federally-recognized Tribes in the requested counties.
